intro: Leontodon haussnechtii, commonly known as the Hausseneck's toothbrush, is a flowering plant native to Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces yellowish to brownish composite flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It typically grows in dry, calcareous soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
